newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Competition key to Australia telecom market growth.
newsitem.headline: Competition key to Australia telecom market growth.

text.p: Effective enforcement of competition law was the key to domestic telecommunications market growth in a deregulated regime, British Telecom's Australian arm said on Friday.
"If the regulators manage to convince new players there is a level playing field, then there will be a lot more players here," BT Australia's managing director Graham Moore told a briefing.
The Australian telecommunications market is due to move to an open access regime from July 1.
The entry of new players though, would mean reduction in local margins unless value was added to existing services.
"Inevitably, that means greater choice and normally leads to lower margins for the operators unless you can come up with new services," Moore said.

The actions of the dominant player, Australian government owned-Telstra Australia, in protecting its business would need monitoring, Moore said, although he was confident a competitive regime would eventually be in place.
